page.title: 09Unemployment.
page.content: {Unemployment }is one of the major problems in Britain today and{Heywood} too is affected. A small survey carried out at a centre for unemployed showed that the majority had had work if only for a short time, but periods of unemployment ranged from 3 weeks to 5 years. {The causes }were seen as a lack of available jobs and the failure of the Government to act and help. The people questioned criticised the lack of help available to them and were dismissive of the {Youth Training {Scheme,}although most of them advised young people leaving school to take exams and, if possible, to get further qualifications. Boredom and lack of money to spend on recreation and clothes were seen as the main personal problems and all saw a connection between unemployment and the rising { {crime rate. }
